abstract: Regulators had charged that the bank misled investors in a $1 billion derivatives deal tied to the United States housing market, then bet against investors as the housing market began to show signs of distress, The New York Times's Edward Wyatt reported.

lead_paragraph: Regulators had charged that the bank misled investors in a $1 billion derivatives deal tied to the United States housing market, then bet against investors as the housing market began to show signs of distress, The New York Times's Edward Wyatt reported. Read more »

headline.main: Citigroup to Pay $285 Million to Settle S.E.C. Charges
